fund.name: LeaderCare
fund.description: By working together as a collaboration of over 40 organizations, we demystify the landscape of available help and leverage informed generosity, making it easier for leaders to take actionable steps toward flourishing in ministry. Our dimensions of flourishing include: Spiritual, Relational, Mental/Physical, Financial, and Vocational. We enable authenticated philanthropy to drive real-world flourishing outcomes for Christian leaders. Through AWARENESS, COLLABORATION, and FUNDING we seek to reverse the current trends around deep isolation and burnout in Christian Leaders.

programs.name: Care & Coaching for Pastors, Church Leaders, and Spouses
programs.description: Our coaches have experienced the joys and difficulties of ministry and will help you make progress and gain perspective on the personal and relational challenges you face serving and leading others.

questions.questionText: What is your full name?
What is the name of your church and your current role?
How many years have you been in ministry?
What is your biggest leadership challenge right now?
What are your top 2-3 goals for this coaching program?
Do you have any scheduling constraints or preferred session times?

programs.name: Strengthening Our Souls
programs.description: Strengthening Our Souls is a self-paced journey through frameworks and practices that will provide the foundation for leading your life and ministry from a grounded, peace-filled place despite surrounding circumstances.

questions.questionText: What is your full name?
What is the name of your church or organization and your role?
What drew you to this program? What do you hope to gain from it?

options: Thriving – I feel deeply connected and at peace
Stable – I have a good rhythm, but there is room to grow
Struggling – I feel drained and need renewal
Uncertain – I'm not sure how to gauge my soul health
questions.questionText: How would you describe your current level of soul health (peace, rest, and spiritual well-being)?
What are the biggest challenges that make it difficult for you to lead from a place of peace and grounding?
Do you have any specific expectations or hopes for how this program might impact your life and ministry?

programs.name: Ministry Couples Retreat
programs.description: Quite often, couples in ministry become so involved in giving to others that their personal lives are neglected. They miss out on the first part of the biblical principle found in Matthew 10:8, 'Freely you have received, freely give.' A Galatians 6:6 Retreat is a time of personal renewal and encouragement for ministry couples...a time to 'freely receive' God's good things for your marriage, family, and ministry. Galatians 6:6 Retreats are 3-day/2-night retreats for pastoral couples in full-time ministry.

questions.questionText: What are your full names (Pastor & Spouse)?
What is the name of your church and your role?
How many years have you been married?
What is one area of your marriage you hope to strengthen during this retreat?
Have you attended a marriage retreat before? If so, what was your experience?
Do you have any dietary restrictions or special accommodations we should be aware of?

user.name: Elowen Thorne
currentChallenges: Balancing family responsibilities with church commitments, leading to feelings of guilt and inadequacy.
Struggling to connect with congregants on a deeper level due to burnout from constant service demands.
Navigating conflicts within the church leadership team that affect personal relationships and morale.
hopefulOutcomes: Gain strategies to manage time effectively between ministry and family life.
Develop deeper interpersonal skills to rebuild trust and connection within the congregation.
Learn conflict resolution techniques to foster a more harmonious leadership environment.

program.name: Care & Coaching for Pastors, Church Leaders, and Spouses
program.description: Our coaches have experienced the joys and difficulties of ministry and will help you make progress and gain perspective on the personal and relational challenges you face serving and leading others.

questions.questionText: What is your full name?
What is the name of your church and your current role?
How many years have you been in ministry?
What is your biggest leadership challenge right now?
What are your top 2-3 goals for this coaching program?
Do you have any scheduling constraints or preferred session times?

responses.response: My full name is Elowen Thorne.
I serve as the Community Outreach Coordinator at my local church, where I work on initiatives that connect our congregation with the wider community.
I have been in ministry for 6 years.

My biggest leadership challenge right now is balancing my family responsibilities with my church commitments. This often leads to feelings of guilt and inadequacy, as I struggle to give my best to both my family and my ministry.

Through this coaching program, I hope to gain strategies to manage my time more effectively between my ministry duties and family life. Additionally, I want to develop deeper interpersonal skills that will help me reconnect with congregants and rebuild trust within the church community. Lastly, I aim to learn effective conflict resolution techniques to foster a more harmonious leadership environment, especially given the current conflicts within our leadership team.

I have some scheduling constraints due to my family commitments, so I would prefer sessions in the evenings after my children are settled for the night. However, I am flexible on weekends if necessary.

questionResponses.answer: The 'Care & Coaching for Pastors, Church Leaders, and Spouses' program has been transformative for me. It provided insightful strategies to manage my time effectively, allowing me to balance my family responsibilities with church commitments, which has significantly reduced my feelings of guilt. The interpersonal skills I developed during the coaching sessions helped me connect with my congregants on a deeper level, revitalizing my passion for ministry. The conflict resolution techniques I learned have fostered a more harmonious environment within our leadership team, greatly improving morale and personal relationships.

question.text: What private message would you like to share with the organizer of this experience about how it helped you grow? Please feel free to share any insights, reflections, or feedback on how this has impacted you. You will have an opportunity to share a public review of this program later.

milestoneReflections.content: Completing my first coaching session was a breath of fresh air. I realized I wasn't alone in my struggles with balancing family and church commitments.

milestone.title: First Coaching Session Completed
milestone.description: Mark as complete when the beneficiary has completed the first session.

milestoneReflections.content: During the second session, I started to unpack my feelings of guilt regarding my family responsibilities. The coach provided me with practical strategies that felt realistic and achievable, which helped me see that I could prioritize both my family and my ministry.

milestone.title: Second Coaching Session Completed
milestone.description: Mark as complete when the beneficiary has completed the second session.

milestoneReflections.content: By the time I completed my third coaching session, I felt a significant shift in my perspective. I learned effective conflict resolution techniques that I could apply within my church leadership team, and I began to feel more empowered to address the underlying issues affecting our morale. The tools I've gained have not only improved my relationships with my colleagues but have also helped me reconnect with my congregants on a deeper level. I'm excited to continue this journey of growth and healing.

milestone.title: Third Coaching Session Completed
milestone.description: Mark as complete when the beneficiary has completed the third session.

review.content: Before participating in the 'Care & Coaching for Pastors, Church Leaders, and Spouses' program, I was grappling with significant challenges in my life as a Community Outreach Coordinator. Balancing my family responsibilities with church commitments left me feeling guilty and inadequate, and I struggled to connect with my congregants on a deeper level due to the burnout that came from constant service demands. Additionally, navigating conflicts within the church leadership team affected both my personal relationships and morale. The program's coaches, who have experienced similar joys and difficulties in ministry, provided me with invaluable support and perspective. They helped me gain strategies to manage my time more effectively between ministry and family life, which has greatly reduced my feelings of guilt. I learned deeper interpersonal skills that have allowed me to rebuild trust and connection within the congregation, and I now feel more equipped to address conflicts within the leadership team using the conflict resolution techniques I acquired. The emotional support and practical tools I received have transformed my approach to both my personal and professional life. I feel more fulfilled and connected in my role, and the stress that once seemed overwhelming has significantly diminished. I wholeheartedly recommend this program to anyone facing similar struggles; it offers the guidance and understanding needed to thrive in ministry while maintaining personal well-being.
